meanings.definition: Thylacines: a carnivorous marsupial native to Tasmania, also known as the Tasmanian tiger.
meanings.sent1: The thylacines were once common in Tasmania.
meanings.sent2: We learned about thylacines in our science class.
meanings.sent3: The thylacines threw a party in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The thylacines' stealthy movements were like shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: The sight of thylacines hunting is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Thylacines: the plural form of thylacine, referring to multiple individuals of the species.
meanings.sent1: I saw a group of thylacines roaming together.
meanings.sent2: The zoo has a special exhibit featuring thylacines.
meanings.sent3: The thylacines organized a soccer match in the wild.
meanings.sent4: The thylacines' unity was as strong as a family bond.
meanings.sent5: The field echoed with the calls of thylacines.
